title: Share of economic sectors in the GDP in Belgium from 2008 to 2018
summary: The given chart is of multi-line type with 3 lines namely Agriculture, Industry, and Services. The y axis represents Share in GDP and the x axis represents Year.
Overall Agriculture, Industry, and Services are roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The lines ordered according to average values of Share in GDP in descending order is: 1. Services, 2. Industry, and lastly, 3. Agriculture.
Overall across the Year, Services mostly maintained the highest Share in GDP when compared to others with a mean value of 68.59, and it peaked at 2018.
After Services, Industry overall has the second highest values , with a mean value of 20.0, peaking at 2008.
The botommost line, Agriculture,  has a mean of 0.67, and peaked at 2012.

max_summary: You are viewing a chart of multi-line type with 3 lines denoting Agriculture, Industry, and Services. The y axis indicates the Share in GDP and the x axis indicates Year.
Overall Agriculture, Industry, and Services are roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The lines ordered according to average values of Share in GDP in descending order is: 1. Services, 2. Industry, and lastly, 3. Agriculture.
Throughout the period, Services generally had the highest Share in GDP relative to others with an average of 68.59, and it reached its maximum at 2018 with a value of 69.54.
After Services, Industry overall has the second highest values , with a mean value of 20.0, peaking at 2008.
Agriculture mostly had the least Share in GDP with a mean value of 0.67, which peaked at 2012 with a value of 0.78.
The minimum Share in GDP about 0.5, occured at 2018 by Agriculture.
